dmv.spring.demo.model.repository.jdbc

Class UserRepositoryComboQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • dmv.spring.demo.model.repository.jdbc.UserRepositoryComboQueries
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserRepository

    @Repository
 @Transactional
public class UserRepositoryComboQueries
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserRepository
    This Repository implementation will use multi-statement SQL queries in order to update and get several results within a single connection. The actual Connection is managed by JdbcConnector helper class
    Author:
    dmv

      • create

        public User create(User user)
        Description copied from interface: UserRepository
        Will store new user on persistence layer. Id will be generated and returned.

        User constraints: fields 'email', 'first name' and 'last name' must be provided; 'email' must be unique. If password was not given it will be generated and returned with the created object.

        For user's roles only 'shortName' parameter is needed. If it is absent or the role with given name does not exist in database the IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        create in interface UserRepository
        Parameters:
        user - A new user to persist
        Returns:
        persisted user on success

      • update

        public User update(User user)
        Description copied from interface: UserRepository
        Will update existing user (found by id) with given user details (password and email fields are omitted, these are different operations).

        For user's roles only 'shortName' parameter is needed. If it is absent or the role with given name does not exist in database the IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        update in interface UserRepository
        Parameters:
        user - An existing user with new profile
        Returns:
        true update was successful

      • delete

        public void delete(User user)
        Description copied from interface: UserRepository
        Will delete existing user (found by id) from persistence layer
        Specified by:
        delete in interface UserRepository
        Parameters:
        user - An existing user

      • getCredentials

        public User getCredentials(java.lang.String email)
        Description copied from interface: UserRepository
        Find user by email address and return with that email and password fields only. For authentication purposes.
        Specified by:
        getCredentials in interface UserRepository
        Parameters:
        email - User's identifier, unique email address
        Returns:
        User with email and password if exists
